review_text: I placed an order for seven laptops from Amazon and receive them on third November 2025. Un inspecting them, I realized that one of the chargers was not working correctly for 1/7 laptops. No call on 18th at all.Eventually, on 19th I called, got transferred three times and eventually Snigdha informed me that "You are too late. The service window has closed. You should have called earlier if the engineer did not visit. We can't do anything!"Amazon is pathetic!

review_title: Dear Amazon Team,
review_text: Dear Amazon Team,I am extremely disappointed and frustrated with your service. This has been one of the worst experiences I’ve ever had with any company. Despite raising multiple complaints and calling your team more than 10 times, my issue is still unresolved. Your investigation team keeps saying “this is the final resolution”, but may I ask — what kind of final resolution is this when you haven’t even provided me with a proper answer or refund?I have called your customer service team on 3 Oct, 13 Oct, 19 Oct, 30 Oct, 6 Nov, 12 Nov, 13 Nov, and even today. Every time I’m promised a solution, but nothing actually happens. My return pickup was never done properly, and yet your team keeps blaming me instead of fixing the issue. This is completely unacceptable.To make matters worse, one of your representatives spoke to me in an extremely unprofessional and rude manner. It’s shocking that a company like Amazon would allow customer service agents who don’t even know how to talk to customers politely.Your investigation team is handling this matter carelessly. When I requested the proof or report of the investigation, your team refused, giving excuses like “security reasons.” This is not transparency — this is hiding your mistakes and trying to put the blame on customers.I am asking again — if your team claims that I denied the pickup, please show me proof of when, where, and to whom I supposedly denied it. I have every right to see the evidence.Because of your negligence, my money is still stuck, my product is uncollected, and my time has been completely wasted. If this issue is not resolved immediately, I will be left with no choice but to escalate this matter to the Consumer Court and share this entire experience publicly.Please process my refund immediately and take strict action against the unprofessional behavior of your customer support and investigation teams.This whole experience has been mentally exhausting, time-wasting, and deeply frustrating. I expect a clear, written response with the proof and an update on my refund status without any further delays.Sincerely,Harshita Order id 406-1639193-4305904

review_title: The Customer service make the false promises.
review_text: I was promised a refund within four hours, yet it has now been over two weeks and I still haven’t received it. The issue was supposedly escalated to a manager, but even then, no refund was processed despite what the original agent assured me on chat.During this time, my chat was transferred between four different agents, none of whom provided any resolution. To make things worse, the TL/manager suddenly closed the chat from their side in the middle of the conversation. After that, I was unable to reconnect with a live agent about the same issue and kept getting pushed to the bot instead. There was no apology, no acknowledgment of the inconvenience, and not even an offer of store credit.I have never seen such an unprofessional customer service team. And saying this in India is a big deal because we already don’t expect very high service standards, but this experience was far worse than anything I’ve encountered.What made the situation even more disappointing is that a US-based agent was able to send me the chat transcript via email without any issue, while the India-based agents treated the situation completely differently. It genuinely felt like customers are handled one way in “first-world” regions and another way elsewhere.They seem fine as long as everything goes smoothly. But the moment you have a problem, the support team keeps transferring the chat instead of helping, and you get stuck with bots instead of actual assistance.I truly hope this review reaches someone who can bring real improvements to their customer service team.Order # 404-9587975-0221130

review_text: Cheating the Indian Government and IndiansSince Amazon terminated our nine KDP accounts with Rupees 48000 in unpaid royalty and Amazon Associates account with Rupees 2300 unpaid, we started Investigations on it. review_title: On 2nd May
review_text: On 1st May 2025, I placed an IPhone order on Amazon India at around 10:30 pm . Ship To location - Bangalore Hulimavu, pin 560076. I chose Amazon as it was providing same day delivery, it was very important that I set up the phone during weekend, weekdays there is hardly any time to set up the phone with apps etc. I was exchanging my old iPhone. Immediately after placing the order, basis of email instructions received from Amazon, I did a reset of the phone deleting data and apps which are my lifeline. I dint expect what was next to come. Waited patiently till 6 pm, the tracking number showed package has reached the final hub at 3:46 pm but didn’t show out for delivery or any estimated time by when the package will be delivered. So now I have no food app on the phone to order food, all social media including Wapp is deleted as I formatted the phone, I am at home patiently waiting for the Amazon delivery person to come. I spent almost 20 mints plus to find the Amazon Cust service chat option (mini treasure hunt), chatted with them and clearly mentioned my frustration for not having any information about the delivery time. I insisted that the Customer Service rep talk to the shipping team to get exact information, but the rep only assured me that the delivery will be received by 8:00 pm IST. So I waited till 7:45 pm IST, but there is still no update on Amazon website. So now I called Amazon Cust service. Clearly the rep started giving some generic reply, without any actual effort to find out why the delivery is delayed. I insisted to speak to a supervisor, yet this attempt was also useless. There was no sense of urgency but generic reply that the cutoff window is 10:00 PM IST, i should wait until then. Here also in spite of insisting that the Cust service team speak to shipping to get exact status, the answer was negative, that Cust service doesn’t contact shipping, then can only raise an expedite request. Finally the delivery dint come, website is now showing delivery on 3rd May, a day after. No explanation given on why it was not delivered and why they need 2 more days to deliver when the status shows the packagae has received the final delivery point.Bottom line, pathetic and useless customer service. They didn’t take any real step to ensure package is delivered, instead gave generic assurance that delivery will happen on time. I also doubt their Business tactics, I have been an Amazon customer for several years. Offset I can see a trend of issues related to high value prepaid orders. Buying a few hundred rupees product is fine but I will recommend to not but high value products, especially prepaid from Amazon. They are 100% non-reliable.

review_title: Excellent Selection and Service, but Room for Improvement
review_text: Amazon offers an extensive range of products, competitive pricing, and efficient delivery, making it a preferred online shopping destination. The user-friendly interface and reliable customer service enhance the overall experience.​However, there are occasional issues with product quality and packaging. Some items received have not met expectations, and packaging can sometimes be inadequate, leading to potential damage during transit.​If Amazon can address these concerns by enhancing quality control and improving packaging standards, it would further solidify its position as a top-tier online retailer.

review_title: Ghastly logistics management & customer service
review_text: Amazon's logistics process has undergone some change and unfortunately not for the better. I had 2 issues with my recent orders. 1. Item was updated as Delivered and not delivered.Tracking ID - has lost meaning - there is no courier contact or POD details. It is impossible to track the item that is pending delivery or reach the delivery agent. The customer service team keeps giving a landline number which keeps playing pre recorded messages - and then disconnects the call saying the person you are calling is unreachable. There is no call to the recipient to confirm time of delivery.The customer service representatives are very polite and quick to apologize but totally unprepared or unable to resolve any issues. Another order made from my wife's account: we had requested for delivery on 26th March and updated delivery instructions to state clearly delivery should be between 10AM to 6PM. The delivery agent attempted delivery on 26th March at 10PM and then said will try next day. Again on 27th March they did tried to deliver at 10PM, my wife spent 30 minutes with customer service representative and was assured the delivery would take place on 28th March. On 28th March we saw you had updated the order as Cancelled and cancellation reason was updated as "rejected by recipient". The customer service team again had no idea who has updated this and why. Needless to say the changes they have made to the logistics process are terrible and end customer experience is despicable. I will definitely think twice before ordering anything on Amazon India going forward. It might be cost effective to have disjointed processes, but when they do not run together and the left hand does not know what the right is doing, it is a recipe for disaster.

review_text: I have been using a big user of Amazon Online Shopping  since its inception.Recently in last 6 months have been noticing their change in policies and also how much they have lost focus on users.Previously I always felt Amazon online shopping is very safe and convenient and had the feeling that they are always their to address any issues with only purchase and delivery.Around 6 months back I noticed that they started shipping products just by pasting a sticker with order details on the original packing of the order. I am not sure whether they delivered with a sticker bill on the product or sent it inside a cover. Reason for my suspicion is they was no original bill attached to the package which said silver coin or ACV Moringa.I contacted Amazon on this, like usually they said don't worry we will resolve.They said they have raised an internal investigation and it will take 5 working days and asked me to contact post that and they will tell me resolution.When I contacted them back post this waiting period they said they have delivered what I ordered ! and they refused to share any further information or evidence which shows that they delivered silver coin.Now I am at loss, as I cannot go legal as it involves cost and I have opened the package. My only evidence is what I have online and chat history. There is no good way I can prove that I was not delivered silver coin and Amazon also is not sharing ANYTHING from there side like a photo which shows silver coin packed. Now conclusion looks like we delivered what you ordered which implies I am lying, which I am not.Saddest past is they are not sharing any part of investigation so that at least I can know where and what went wrong.I have lost complete trust now to order anything expensive and may be will limit my shopping to only cheap items.Posting this as a WARNING MESSAGE to all who order lot of expensive items like Phones, TVs, jewellery, silver and what not ...Please think twice before you order in Amazon India. review_title: Indian government must take action against Amazon.in
review_text: I have used Amazon services in India, the UAE, and the UK, and it’s clear that Amazon’s customer service depends heavily on the consumer protection laws in each country. Unfortunately, Amazon India (AmazonIn) provides the worst service, which seems linked to the weaker customer protection laws in India. Instead of improving delivery and customer support, AmazonIn focuses on manipulating its performance metrics (KPIs), often at the expense of customer satisfaction.Recently, I ordered a kids’ play pool for my toddler during a short vacation. The item reached a delivery hub just 5 kilometres from my house, in a suburban area, on a Friday. However, Friday deliveries are often marked as "customer unreachable," even when they aren’t. This tactic delays the delivery and allows Amazon to avoid immediate accountability. When I contacted Amazon, they refused to deliver the item from the nearby hub and instead offered to send a replacement from a hub over 1,000 kilometres away. Frustrated by the delay, I cancelled the order and chose a different product.The second item, which had a two-day Prime delivery promise, faced more issues. It was delayed at a main hub and then cancelled entirely before reaching the local hub. Amazon’s only solution was to send another replacement at their convenience, leaving me even more frustrated.These experiences show that Amazon*In focuses more on managing internal targets than solving customer problems. With no strong consumer protection laws in India, the company faces little accountability and continues to test customer patience and loyalty. Until stronger laws are introduced, customers in India will keep facing these issues.
